resources.string: The month of Sol is a special month located in the middle of the year.
Year Day is the last day of the year.
What is the International Fixed Calendar?

The International Fixed Calendar (IFC) is a calendar system consisting of 13 months, each with exactly 28 days. Unlike the traditional Gregorian calendar, this system has a more consistent and predictable structure.

• 13 months, each with 28 days
• Each month starts and ends on the same day
• In leap years, a "Leap Day" is added
• A "Year Day" is added at the end of the year
• Days of the week repeat on the same dates each month

1. January
2. February
3. March
4. April
5. May
6. June
7. Sol
8. July
9. August
10. September
11. October
12. November
13. December

• Easier planning and organization
• Simplified calculations due to equal month lengths
• Days of the week repeat on the same dates each month
• More consistent structure for commercial and financial operations
• Potential for international standardization
The International Fixed Calendar was proposed in 1902 by Moses B. Cotsworth. The Kodak company used this calendar between 1928 and 1989. It is still used by some organizations and individuals today.
